sections.text: Python allows you to assign values to multiple variables in one line:

sections.subtitle: Example
sections.text:
x, y, z = "Orange", "Banana", "Cherry"
print(x)
print(y)
print(z)
Make sure the number of variables matches the number of values, or else you will get an error.

sections.subtitle: One Value to Multiple Variables
sections.text: And you can assign the same value to multiple variables in one line

sections.subtitle: Example
sections.text:
x, y, z = "Orange", "Banana", "Cherry"
print(x)
print(y)
print(z)

sections.subtitle: Unpack a Collection
sections.text: If you have a collection of values in a list, tuple etc. Python allows you to extract the values into variables. This is called unpacking.

sections.subtitle: Example
sections.text:
fruits = ["apple", "banana", "cherry"]
x, y, z = fruits
print(x)
print(y)
print(z)

Learn more about unpacking in our Unpack Tuples Chapter.
